alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 4:56AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS LIKELY ACROSS EASTERN KENAI PENINSULA AND EASTERN TURNAGAIN ARM THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers are likely across the Seward Highway Corridor from Girdwood and Whittier south to Seward Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. While snow showers are expected at any time between this morning and Thursday morning, the best chance for moderate to heavy snow showers will be Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening and again overnight Wednesday into early Thursday morning. Snowfall rates in heavier snow showers could reach one to two inches per hour, leading to significantly reduced visibilities. Gusty winds Thursday morning could also result in localized areas of blowing snow, especially near Whittier and Seward. Additional snow accumulations of 6 inches or more are possible for Whittier, Portage Valley, and Turnagain Pass through Thursday morning. 1 to 3 inches of snow are possible from Summit Lake to Seward.

area.areaDesc: East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound
